Posts.Content: Trabby wrote: If anyone has read any of my earlier posts, you'll know I've been dealing with a breast issue since 2008. The lump is still there, never shows on ultrasound. I had an ultrasound in April which didn't show the lump, however they found a small cyst. I was booked for a recheck after 3 months. Two weeks ago I has another ultrasound, and today I had my follow up. Ultrasound once again did not find the lump, the cyst that was there 3 months ago is no longer there. They did however find two new cysts and an abnormally large auxiliary lymph node. I am now booked for an ultrasound guided core biopsy on Monday the 8th. So that has me pretty nervous at this point. How can I best prepare for this? I haven't googled the procedure as of yet, just read the handout they gave me. Also is it normal to biopsy the node rather than yank it out??? Any input would be greatly appreciated. Log in to post a reply

Two days later she was diagnosed with an invasive breast cancer. Needless to say talking to her did not give me any extra confidence.

Posts.Content: Trabby wrote: I have not been diagnosed with anything however I am freaked out. A little over a year ago my menstrual cycle went all out of whack, around the same time I noticed that there was a very small amount of milk? in my right breast. Dr said hormones hormones  whatever scanned my head to see if I had a pituitary tumor and dismissed all of it.Since my cycle has regulated itself and my boob no longer has a tiny leak but it has been tender for over a year. I had my first ever breast exam a little over a month ago , she found nothing and once again my tenderness is apparently due to hormones because im 31. She also said that breast cancer on my dads side of the family is not overly relavent because it comes from maternal side. My dads mom had a large benign lump removed from her breast and uterus. Her mother and aunt both died of breast cancer. My dad's dad, has two sisters both whom have had reoccurent breast cancer. How can this have no relavence? I asked  at my last appnt, for a referral to the breast health clinic only to be told that it was for people who  needed it . My tenderness is non cyclical and I have now found a lump ( lymphnode? ) on the outer edge/ rib area of my breast that is also tender but not the original tender spot. Do I wait it out or go to a night clinic and try to get a referral there? Very confused..... maybe I just worry too much Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Do I worry too much? Trabby sheila888

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 12:13AM Trabby wrote: Hi nlm, thank you for your response. I have not had an MRI, nor do I think they would even consider it. Dr said that there are several enlarged axillary nodes the largest measures 36x10x28mm, therefore he ordered the biopsy. I personally do not know what it all means. What I do know however is that the medical system is two faced they preach early detection, yet you can walk around for two years with the same lump that nobody seems to care about or even want to put a name to. I suspect that in 17 years when I'm eligible for a mammogram maybe I'll be lucky enough to get a definitive explanation to what the lump is.
Posts.Title: Biopsy cancelled Trabby meme31

Posts.Content: Trabby wrote: So after two years of having a persistent, mystery lump in my right breast , I am getting ready to unleash the wrath of me upon my family dr. I have had two ultrasounds in the past two years neither has shown "the lump". Me, my husband, family dr and ultrasound tech can all feel it. I was told that my right breast is denser than the left and it's most likely due to hormones and age related changes is the breast. Two years ago I requested a mammo after the clear ultrasound, apparently they will not do a mammo because I'm in my 30s and that breast is dense. The latest ultrasound although it didn't find the lump they found a 3x2x5 cyst which I was told is too small to do anything with. So they are going to see me again in 3 months...... So now this brings me to paternal family history..... From the very beginning of this I was told family history only counts on my moms side.... There is no breast cancer on her side. My fathers side however does have breast cancer, both his moms side and fathers side...... I spoke with my great aunt today who is a breast cancer survivor. She has had two recurrences and has had both breasts removed..... She urged me to press this issue..... Her initial lump did NOT show on mammo, did NOT show on ultrasound. Needle biopsy came back OK. She personally wasn't happy until she sought a second opinion. It was then she was offered to have it taken out.... Two days later she was diagnosed with invasive cancer. I cannot understand why my dr is soooo adamant that his side of the family's history doesn't matter. Last time I checked I believe i inherited half of my DNA from him. How do I go about getting the answers I need? I just want to know exactly what this is..... I feel like I am being dismissed and discriminated against because of my age...... And irrelevant paternal history. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Paternal breast cancer history Trabby SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2011 02:44PM Trabby wrote: Thanks for your reply candDsmom, I am planning on giving my family dr a lambasting on my dads side cancer history. After that she can decide wether to break the rules and get me a mammo or continue to do nothing other than tell me how hormonal women are in their 30's. The most frustrating thing about this is that they can't tell me what the lump is. There's so many things other than cancer that it could be and probably is...... I just want it to have a formal name. Over the last few years I have really lost faith in the medical system..... They preach early detection but impose all of these guidelines that either open or close the door to full assessment of the problem. Also there is not a single female dr in my city who will see new patients, I'm a little hesitant to walk into some strange male dr's office and whip out my boob on the first visit. I find it very Unnerving that my great aunts cancer was missed by us/mammo and biopsy.... Luckily she got her diagnoses after she had it cut out.

Posts.Title: This cant be good Trabby CameoBarbie

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2009 03:59PM Trabby wrote: Well I was actually quite productive in the hot hot heat! Managed to clean out and take down the kids big pool. Sort of depressing the amount of leaves that are falling, I would have liked to be able to swim to cool off but were one step ahead of fall by getting it down.projects are definately good for occupying the mind.Tuesday is creeping up so this is good, today my daughter is home from school again with an eye infection.tomorrow is my oldest sons 12th birthday, then the weekend. The distractions seem to be adding up :) in regards to Mary.... My Dad said that without he believes he would have died!! Bizarre I thought but this is what he told me.... His first couple treatments. He was so sick that he literally puked and sweat 10 pounds off. He felt like he had been poisoned. Then his buddy offerd to drive him to and from chemo....he brought WEED. Apparently my dad smoked it in the truck on the way home.that was the key, he said if he smoked right after chemo B4 the vomit and sweating and chills ect started... The side effects were manageble and he was hungryand able to eat.So as weird as it was. My parents explained to me that dad was smoking pot and it was helping his cancer.my mom would roll joints for my dad on chemo days b4 she caught the bus to work.he confided this with his chemo nurse and she said it was fabulous that he was managing so well.not only did my dad beat his cancer, he did not loose his hair and he managed to stay somewhat healthy through the ordeal. I don't know if the results are the same for everyone but I. Know for some its definately worth the try. Marshmellow where in our beutiful country are you? I'm in southern alberta. Geoshanna if I knew I was going to loose my hair I would go with a bizzare doo too pink mohawk?? Lol something crazy...why not?? Anyways I hope everyone has a great day!!

My ultrasound is schedualed for the 19th @12:45, I cannot quit thinking about it. I have had a stomach ache since tuesday when my dr also felt my  lump. I guess I am hoping that the lump or the tenderness is gone.......its not in fact i think i can feel lympnodes as well. I really really hope, and after all the statistics are in my favor that this is just some freakish thing that is b9 and I will have nothing to worry about. but WHO KNEW that even as small as 20%   out of 100% could wind your clock so tight and fill your mind with the random thoughts of what if? Afterall this issue with my breast that has been since may of 08 , exept the lump is new. I am a very shy girl especially with my breasts, so believe me actually going to the dr and talking  to her about it ect has been really hard. Letting some stranger US my boob next week is almost one of the worst things I have had to do. The length of time that this has gone on only to be told that I am hormonal , but now to find a lump has me terrified! Log in to post a reply
